subject: Sleep
title: Forgetting Is Part of Memory
description: A quick, practical guide to Forgetting Is Part of Memory.

hook.text: Your brain doesn't save everything from the day. If it did, you'd drown in irrelevant details.

buildup.text: During sleep, the brain actively prunes weak neural connections formed during the day.

discovery.text: This process called synaptic homeostasis strengthens important memories and discards trivial ones.

twist.text: Without this overnight pruning, the brain would eventually saturate and lose the ability to learn new things.

climax.text: Sleep decides what to keep and what to discard. Forgetting is not failure. It's curation.

punchline.text: Sleep helps you remember by helping you forget.

quiz.question: What is synaptic homeostasis during sleep?
options: Pruning weak connections and strengthening important ones
